name: Water Days – Author Discussion
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. We are given a sense of how untrammeled urbanization has turned the local administration rogue and uncaring. All along, men and women line up to collect water and stories in the dead of night. 

Join us to discuss the themes mentioned in this book with Sundar Sarrukai, author and Srikar Raghavan, writer and researcher.

name: Book Discussion : WATER DAYS with Sundar Sarukkai and Srikar Raghavan
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. We are given a sense of how untrammeled urbanization has turned the local administration rogue and uncaring. All along, men and women line up to collect water and stories in the dead of night. 

Join us to discuss the themes mentioned in this book with Sundar Sarrukai, author and Srikar Raghavan, writer and researcher.

name: Screening of Before Film Series by Richard Linklater - Before Sunset (2004)
description:
Join us over the long weekend for special screening of Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004) on Friday and Saturday night at Underline Center!

What is the Before series?

Richard Linklater’s trilogy of Before Sunrise, Before Sunset, and Before Midnight tells the heartfelt, surprising tale of the joys and pains of modern love.

The films, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, follow the evolving relationship of Jesse and Celine over a period of 18 years. Each film is set about nine years apart, capturing different stages of their lives and relationship. It’s widely considered one the greatest film trilogies, and is notable for its extensive use of dialogue, with conversations driving the narrative and exploring themes of love, time, and relationships. The films are characterized by long, intimate conversations between the main characters, which often delve into their thoughts, feelings, and philosophies.

name: Manga Reading Room with Ishan
description:
We’re starting a manga library and reading room!

Come enjoy a quiet environment where you can browse and read from our collection of manga, and connect with fellow enthusiasts from the community.

If you’ve never read manga before and are just curious about the hype, this is a great place to start!

Please note: Books cannot be borrowed or taken outside the library. Since these are from a personal collection, access is limited to the duration of the event.
Who is Ishan?

Ishan is an avid manga reader, game master, and all-around fandom enthusiast. He wants more people to fall in love with the things he loves, and this event is his way of sharing his large manga collection with the community.

name: Improv Essentials: A Crash Course by Improv Lore
description:
Want to improvise but keep missing our Level 1 intensive? Learn the basics in our crash course!

We’ll take you from no performing experience to loving the stage
What we’ll cover:

    Basic stagecraft

    Trusting your ideas

    Working (playing) well with others

    Short-form improv games

    An introduction to longform improv

What you get:

    6 hours of workshop

    Access to select cast-only jams

    A discount on the next Level 1 intensive

Schedule:

Day 1: Saturday, 16th August - 11am to 2pm
Day 2: Sunday, 17th August - 11am to 2pm

name: Yoga with Sisters & Misters
description:
Yoga - With the Sisters and Misters
PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN MATS :))
Progressive Vinyasa classes with Chanchal are a blend of breath work, strong but approachable flow, mindful postural focus, and deep soothing support.
Classes cultivate balance, stability, flexibility, mobility and vigor as the asana ebbs and flows between effort and ease.
Students can expect a mix of both traditional lineage based practices & progressive movement intended for modern bodies and demands.
Yoga Instructor: Chanchal
Meeting time: 8:15 
Meeting Point: CCD Square
For any further queries contact
Vaishnavi- 6380349608

name: Visible Mending 101
description:
You can bring something you’d like to mend, or practice on fabric scraps as we explore simple techniques like darning, and patchwork.

Visible mending shows that repairing is not just practical, but beautiful. It's a way to care for our clothes, extend their life, and add a touch of personality and colour along the way.

All materials will be provided, but feel free to bring your own garment to work on.

name: Zines for Safer Futures
description:
✨ Zine-making x Safe Futures ✨

What does safety feel like?
A hand to hold, a route you trust, a number you always text.
This workshop is a space to remember, reimagine, and reclaim.

We’re bringing back #TextWhenYouGetHome, not just as a phrase, but as a movement.

Through scissors, glue, stories, and stillness, we’ll make zines that hold the textures of our experiences and futures we want to shape.
Come reflect, create, and connect.

🎨 No art skills needed
🧵 Just show up with your stories, your feelings, your questions

👀 Limited spots. Link in bio to sign up

name: Desi Breakfast Club
description:
From the deep, masala-laden bite of Bedmi Poori to the indulgent fluff of Chole Bhature, every plate is a page from a desi breakfast diary.

Craving something richer? Keema Pav brings the heat. And the Parathas? Stuffed, griddled, and made exactly the way they should be — with love, ghee, and no shortcuts.

This isn’t a meal. It’s a morning well spent.

Now Serving Desi Breakfast only at Treat.
Every Sunday 09:30 am - 11:30 am

PLEASE NOTE: We have two time slots available for the Desi Breakfast Club:

Slot 1 - 09:30 AM - 10:15 AM
Slot 2 - 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM

- Once you send in your reservation request, our team will get in touch to confirm your preferred timing. If your chosen slot is full, we’ll happily offer you the next available one.

- To reserve your spot, we’re charging a small fee of ₹200 per person—which is fully redeemable against your meal. You’re free to choose anything from the menu, and if your bill goes over, you can simply settle the difference at the restaurant.

Can’t wait to see you at the Desi Breakfast Club ☀️

name: The Chaat Craft
description: The Chaat Craft invites participants to a culinary chaat-making competition at Salt Restaurant Bar & Grill. Attendees will experience a fusion of art and flavor in a fun and flavorful event.

location.name: Bhartiya Mall of Bengaluru, Thanisandra Main Rd
location.address: Bhartiya Mall of Bengaluru, Thanisandra Main Rd, Bangalore

name: Raj Bhavan Open
description: To celebrate India's 79th Independence Day, Raj Bhavan in Bengaluru, Karnataka will be open to the public. Known for being one of the most prestigious buildings in the state, this historical landmark offers a unique opportunity to explore its gardens and colonial architecture. Visitors will have access to areas that are typically off-limits, providing a rare glimpse into its grandeur.

name: Eco friendly clay Ganesha workshop
description: Participants will learn to craft eco-friendly Ganesha idols using clay, fostering a connection with traditional Indian art while promoting sustainability. This workshop combines artistic skills with environmental consciousness.

name: Kaaya
description: Kaaya is a play exploring feminism, self-realization, liberation, social justice, personal transformation, and female spirituality, inspired by Akka's vachanas. It aims to highlight the importance of women's rights and freedom, inspiring women to embrace their power and celebrating Akka's enduring legacy. The performance features elements of silence and stillness, encouraging the audience to appreciate slowness in today's fast-paced world. Conceived, choreographed, and directed by Veena Basavarajaiah, the play features Laxmi Chandrashekar, Sripriya, Anagha Kashyap, Kavya Srinivasan, and Harshitha Bhat as performers, with music by Murali Mohan Gowda and lighting by Veena Basavarajaiah. Suitable for ages 16 and above.

location.name: Shoonya Art & Culture Association, Lal Bagh Main Rd
location.address: Shoonya Art & Culture Association, Lal Bagh Main Rd, Bangalore

name: Wedding Album
description: Wedding Album is a Theatre event.

name: Veda Nāda - World's only Vedic Concert
description: A unique concert experience showcasing the essence of Vedic chants and music, promising a deeply spiritual and enriching experience.

location.name: MLR Convention Centre, JP Nagar
location.address: MLR Convention Centre, JP Nagar, Bangalore

name: It Is You
description: IT IS YOU is a nonverbal play that uses movement and sound to tell a story. Featuring seasoned performers Vivek Vijayakumaran and Pangambam Tyson Meitei, the play invites audience participation and interpretation. It's a unique theatrical experience designed to evoke emotional resonance and primal forms of human expression.

name: Tour of Trees At NGMA
description: This guided tour invites participants to explore the lush greenery surrounding the National Gallery of Modern Art. Participants will learn about local flora, ecosystems, and the importance of trees in urban spaces.

location.name: National Gallery Of Modern Art, Vasanth Nagar
location.address: National Gallery Of Modern Art, Vasanth Nagar, Bangalore

name: SAKHI Festival 2025
description: The Sakhi Festival, conceptualized by Smt. Sisira Das, is a unique celebration of India's classical dance and music, envisioned as a space where tradition meets innovation. It embodies the essence of companionship and collaboration, nurturing India's rich cultural heritage through performances by renowned artists. This third day of the festival promises to be a vibrant showcase of talent, bringing together the community to appreciate the beauty and depth of classical art forms.

location.name: New Horizon College of Engineering, Outer Ring Rd
location.address: New Horizon College of Engineering, Outer Ring Rd, Bangalore

name: Nrutya Beru
description: Experience Karnataka’s vibrant folk dance heritage with Nrutya Beru, a lecture demonstration by dance practitioner and researcher Sneha Kappanna. This program explores the depth, symbolism, and evolution of the state’s folk dances, offering audiences a detailed view of lesser known cultural legacies. Based on her acclaimed book Nrutya Beru, Sneha’s presentation connects Karnataka’s folk forms to global dance traditions while showcasing her research methodology and will feature demonstrations of forms like Pattada Kunitha, Soligara Kunitha, Kamsale and Lambani. A recipient of multiple awards, Sneha Kappanna has documented, performed, and works towards the preservation of numerous folk dances - many traditionally performed only by men - ensuring their relevance for future generations.

location.name: IME, Performance Theatre, JP Nagar
location.address: IME, Performance Theatre, JP Nagar, Bangalore

name: Manav Kaul's Aisa Kehte Hai
description: Aisa Kehte Hain is a Hindi play written by Manav Kaul that beautifully captures the complexities of love through the lens of storytelling. Set in a deserted railway station, a young man spins a gripping tale for his beloved, intertwining quirky moments with an engaging cast of characters. The narrative not only unfolds the essence of romance but also brings to life the unpredictable nature of life itself. The play invites the audience into a world where stories breathe and relationships blossom, ensuring an unforgettable theatrical experience.

name: Mysterious Object at Noon
description: Shoonya Art and Cultural Association is hosting 'Mysterious Object at Noon', a screening in collaboration with The Parallel Cinema Club. This event will take place on Saturday, featuring the work of Apichatpong Weerasethakul. The film invites the audience into a journey through Thailand as a camera crew engages villagers in creating the next chapter of a continuous narrative.

location.name: Shoonya Art & Culture Association, Lal Bagh Main Rd
location.address: Shoonya Art & Culture Association, Lal Bagh Main Rd, Bangalore

name: Neapolitan Pizza Making
description: This community cooking and dining experience invites you to engage all five senses in the kitchen. The focus is on creating a delicious Neapolitan pizza together, learning to make and stretch the dough, assemble it with various toppings and cheeses, and bake it in a wood-fired oven. The meal includes a Virgin Mojito, the pizza you've made, and dessert. Vegetarian and non-vegetarian options are available. The experience is led by an expert chef and includes an exclusive recipe e-booklet.

name: Sideral: Live
description: Sideral Live at Sunburn Union features the artistic rebirth of Diego Gennaro, formerly known as Bastinov. After a two-year hiatus, Sideral has returned with cinematic soundscapes, hypnotic grooves, and collaborations with giants like Mind Against, Afterlife, and CamelPhat, redefining the underground sound. The event promises an intimate journey into deep, atmospheric electronic music.
